intro: Draba bernensii, commonly known as the alpine penny-cress, is a small flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its simple, basal leaves and small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cold, high-altitude climates. Draba bernensii is known for its ability to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. Its flowers bloom in early spring, contributing to the biodiversity of its mountainous ecosystems.
